name: prefetch
usage:
prefetch [options] <SRA accession> [...]
Download SRA files and their dependencies

prefetch [options] --cart <kart file>
Download cart file

prefetch [options] <URL> --output-file <FILE>
Download URL to FILE

prefetch [options] <URL> [...] --output-directory <DIRECTORY>
Download URL or URL-s to DIRECTORY

prefetch [options] <SRA file> [...]
Check SRA file for missed dependencies and download them

options.description: Specify file type to download. Default: sra
Transport: one of: fasp; http; both [default]. (fasp only; http only; first try fasp (ascp), use http if cannot download using fasp).
Location of data.
Minimum file size to download in KB (inclusive).
Maximum file size to download in KB (exclusive). Default: 20G

Force object download: one of: no, yes, all, ALL. no [default]: skip download if the object if found and complete; yes: download it even if it is found and is complete; all: ignore lock files (stale locks or it is being downloaded by another process use at your own risk!); ALL: ignore lock files, restart download from beginning.
Resume partial downloads: one of: no, yes [default].
Verify after download: one of: no, yes [default].
Show progress.
Time period in minutes to display download progress. (0: no progress), default: 1
Don't download QUALITY column.
Double-check all refseqs.
Check for refseqs in downloaded files: one of: no, yes, smart [default]. Smart: skip check for large encrypted non-sra files.
Kart prefetch order when downloading kart: one of: kart, size. (in kart order, by file size: smallest first), default: size.
Kart rows to download (default all). Row list should be ordered.
PATH to jwt cart file.
PATH to ngc file.
To read kart file.
Path to ascp program and   private key file (asperaweb_id_dsa.putty)
Arbitrary options to pass to ascp command line.
Write file to FILE when downloading single file.
Save files to DIRECTORY/
Output brief explanation for the program.
Display the version of the program then quit.
Logging level as number or enum string. One of (fatal|sys|int|err|warn|info|debug) or (0-6) Current/default is warn.
Increase the verbosity of the program status messages. Use multiple times for more verbosity. Negates quiet.
Turn off all status messages for the program. Negated by verbose.
Read more options and parameters from the file.
